info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 5:23PM EDT until July 11 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan and Chatham.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of Chatham and Bryan Counties. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, Windsor Forest, Hunter Army Airfield, Coffee Bluff, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Downtown Savannah, Midtown Savannah, Savannah International Airport and Wilmington Island.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING
